alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 22 at 2:07PM MDT until October 24 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 possible. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Watch, from Sunday morning through Sunday afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates. Avoid outdoor burning or any activity that may cause sparks. The strong winds will likely fuel rapid fire growth. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent water pipes from freezing; wrap or drain or allow them to drip slowly.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
